intro: Valerianella plagiostephana, commonly known as the mountain valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Valerianella plagiostephana is often found in meadows and open slopes at high altitudes, where it thrives in cooler climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
